context_of_use: The customer wants to add products to their shopping cart in preparation for purchase.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to purchase multiple items easily
description: This use case allows customers to add items to their shopping cart and perform related cart actions in preparation for purchase.
triggering_event: Customer decides to add a product to the cart.
preconditions: Customer is logged into their account.
Customer has selected a product to add.
postconditions: The product is successfully added to the shopping cart.
The shopping cart reflects the updated item count.
assumptions: The customer has access to the internet.
The shopping cart system is operational.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to add products to their cart.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects a product → System displays product details.
2. Customer clicks 'Add to Cart' → System adds the product to the shopping cart.
3. Customer views the shopping cart → System displays the updated cart with the new item.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the product is out of stock, then the system displays an out-of-stock message and does not add the product.
